comments:
I've created simple EMF model like this (emfatic-like syntax):

class ClassName {
   ref ClassName[*]#opposite direct;
   readonly ref ClassName[*]#direct opposite;
}

i.e. each instance of ClassName could refer another instances of ClassName and referenced instances will store "back" references as well.

Then generate the code, open generated editor and:
- create an instance ClassName1
- add itself to the "direct" list
- store model
- reopen generated editor -> corresponding reference will not be loaded, .log contains exception:

Created an attachment (id=35152)
Unit-test attached

I've created a unit-test reproducing the same problem without generating the code with EMF (using EMF reflection API to create instances of custom metamodel)

Alex,

I've not had time to look closely (hopefully tommorow) but I suspect that using XMLResource.OPTION_DEFER_IDREF_RESOLUTION set to Boolean.TRUE as a load option would avoid this problem.  This option often improves performance as well.
XMLResource.OPTION_DEFER_IDREF_RESOLUTION helps! What about using it by the generated ecore editor?
Very very few models suffer from this particular problem (mostly to do with self references), so I'm not so inclined to make it a default option.

Alex,

I hate to return this bug since you guys do a heck of a lot for adding value to EMF, GEF, and Eclipse for that matter.  My thinking is that you can manually add this load option to the generated resource factory class pretty easily for what I believe is the rare case of a model with this type of problem. But if you think this is more important than what I'm thinking, we could try to detect the pattern in the model and generate the option conditionally.  

Please let me know your thinking.

Ed, 

I agree with you. If you think, this is a rare situation then it doesn't make sense to modify EMF templates to handle it. In case of GMF we will need these cross-references, so I'm going to modify generated code to correctly load corresponding resources. Currently I've done the following modifications:

In generated GMFGenEditor.GMFGenEditor() I'm adding XMLResource.OPTION_DEFER_IDREF_RESOLUTION into the load options of the created editingDomain: editingDomain.getResourceSet().getLoadOptions().put(XMLResource.OPTION_DEFER_IDREF_RESOLUTION, Boolean.TRUE); 

So result resource should get that option on execution editingDomain.loadResource() method. 

Now I'm receiving java.lang.StackOverflowError on attempt to load any .gmfgen model (even the models which was processed correctly before) but I'd like to investigate it a bit more before reporting a problem.

So we decided that request should not be fixed for all EMF models and I'm ?losing this bugzilla entry and we can continue discussion by e-mail.

Thanks for your help!

I see.  Yes, it doesn't really make sense to have only one end not be changeable since updating either end will update both ends. (Yet another constraint we should check for.) Perhaps you just wanted to supress the setter from the API?  That's also possible but by using an Ecore annotation...
